content: Had a deep chat with my old mentor about my trading losses. He reminded me to focus on risk management first. Starting to see where I went wrong.
Revamped my risk management strategy. It's not just about potential gains anymore; it's about protecting what I have. Feels like a small victory.
Spent the day coding. My proprietary trading algorithm is taking shape. It's like piecing together a puzzle. Exciting but frustrating at times.
A friend from college called. We talked about life, work, and support. It's grounding to have these connections, especially when things feel uncertain.
Hit a snag in the blockchain course. Spent hours debugging. It's humbling, but I'm learning so much about the intricacies of this tech.
Met a blockchain expert at a café. We geeked out over coffee, and I got some insider tips on where the tech is heading. Networking pays off.
My algorithm's first test run was a mess. But, it's back to the drawing board. Each failure is a lesson in what not to do next time.
Spent the weekend with family. They've always been my rock. Their encouragement helps me stay grounded and focused on my goals.
Finally, a breakthrough in my algorithm. It's performing better than expected. The late nights and coffee are paying off.
Got an email from a mentor. He's interested in my work and wants to discuss potential collaboration. This could be a big step forward.
Reflecting on these past 4 days, I've come far. The journey's just begun, but I'm building something substantial, one step at a time.
